intro: Sarcosperma tonkinense, commonly known as the Vietnamese tamarind tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and alternate, simple leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by edible, acidic fruits similar to tamarind. Its botanical features make it valuable for both ornamental and medicinal purposes. It thrives in humid climates and is often found in lowland forests.
